result.markdown:
---
title: "Text Mining"
author: "Sabrina Michl"
date: "2023-01-25"
categories: [code, analysis]
bibliography: ref.bib
image: image.jpg
---


# 1. Preliminary Note

For this analysis we use the dataset from @data/0B5VML_2019 out of the zip archive @data/0B5VML/XIUWJ7_2019. The data are licensed according to Attribution 4.0 International (CC-BY-4.0).

The used wordembeddings are from @grave2018learning. The data are licensed according to Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported (CC-BY-SA 3.0).

The picture, that is used is from @bildquelle.

# 2. Load The Packages

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(rio)
library(tidymodels)
library(tidytext)
library(textrecipes)
library(lsa)
library(discrim)
library(naivebayes)
library(tictoc)
library(fastrtext)
library(remoji)
library(tokenizers)
```
:::


# 3. Load Dataset And Minor Changes
## Train Dataset


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_train <- read_tsv("C:/Users/sapi-/OneDrive/Studium/5. Semester/Data Science II/Data_Science_Blog/daten/germeval2018.training.txt", col_names = FALSE)
```
:::


### Rename Columns


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
names(d_train) <- c("text", "c1", "c2")
```
:::


### Add ID Column


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_train <- d_train %>% 
  mutate(id = row_number()) %>% 
  select(id, everything())
```
:::


## Test Dataset

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_test <- read_tsv("C:/Users/sapi-/OneDrive/Studium/5. Semester/Data Science II/Data_Science_Blog/daten/germeval2018.test.txt", col_names = FALSE)
```
:::


### Rename Columns

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
names(d_test) <- c("text", "c1", "c2")
```
:::


### Add ID Column

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_test <- d_test %>% 
  mutate(id = row_number()) %>% 
  select(id, everything())
```
:::


# 4. Explore Dataset

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
train_toc <- d_train %>% 
  unnest_tokens(output = token, input = text)
train_toc
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 100,217 x 4
      id c1    c2    token         
   <int> <chr> <chr> <chr>         
 1     1 OTHER OTHER corinnamilborn
 2     1 OTHER OTHER liebe         
 3     1 OTHER OTHER corinna       
 4     1 OTHER OTHER wir           
 5     1 OTHER OTHER würden        
 6     1 OTHER OTHER dich          
 7     1 OTHER OTHER gerne         
 8     1 OTHER OTHER als           
 9     1 OTHER OTHER moderatorin   
10     1 OTHER OTHER für           
# ... with 100,207 more rows
```
:::
:::


> First we tokenize the dataset d_train.

## Insert `Stopwords_de`

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
data(stopwords_de, package = "lsa")
stopwords_de <- tibble(word = stopwords_de)
stopwords_de <- stopwords_de %>% 
  rename(token = word)
```
:::


> After that we use the stopwords_de to `anti_join` this with train_toc.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
train_toc2 <- train_toc %>% 
  anti_join(stopwords_de)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Joining, by = "token"
```
:::
:::


## Show The Important Words

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
train_toc2 <- train_toc2 %>% 
  count(token, sort = TRUE) 
```
:::


### Plot

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
train_toc2 %>% 
  slice_head(n=20) %>%  
  ggplot()+
  aes(y=reorder(factor(token), n), x = n, color = token)+
  geom_col(aes(fill = token, alpha = 2.5)) +
  ggtitle("The most used words") +
  ylab("token")+
  xlab("quantity")+
  theme_minimal()+
  theme(legend.position = "none")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


> We see that, to most used word is "lbr". We could inspect the dataset way deeper, e. g. do a manual sentimentanalyse or do lemmatization or stem the words. But we will have a look to these types in the different machine learning algorithmen now.

# 5. Preparation

## 5.1 Define Recipe - rec1 - TF-IDF


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
rec1 <-
  recipe(c1 ~ ., data = select(d_train, text, c1, id)) %>% 
  update_role(id, new_role = "id") %>% 
  step_tokenize(text) %>% 
  step_stopwords(text, language = "de", stopword_source = "snowball") %>% 
  step_stem(text) %>% 
  step_tfidf(text) %>% 
  step_normalize(all_numeric_predictors())
rec1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Recipe

Inputs:

      role #variables
        id          1
   outcome          1
 predictor          1

Operations:

Tokenization for text
Stop word removal for text
Stemming for text
Term frequency-inverse document frequency with text
Centering and scaling for all_numeric_predictors()
```
:::
:::


### Prep & Bake - rec1

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
rec1_prep <- rec1 %>% 
  prep() %>% 
  recipes::bake(new_data = NULL)
```
:::


## 5.2 Define Recipe - rec2 - word embedding
### Insert The Predefined List


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
out_file_model <- "C:/Users/sapi-/OneDrive - Hochschule für Angewandte Wissenschaften Ansbach/Desktop/AWM/angewandte Wirtschats- und Medienpsychologie/5. Semester/Word_Embedding/de.300.bin"
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
file.exists(out_file_model)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] TRUE
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
fasttext_model <- load_model(out_file_model)
dictionary <- get_dictionary(fasttext_model)
get_word_vectors(fasttext_model, c("menschen")) %>% `[`(1:10)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 [1] -0.043737594 -0.033647023 -0.016398411  0.037433818  0.029863771
 [6] -0.008217440  0.002691153 -0.027484305 -0.058012061  0.004103063
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
print(head(dictionary, 10))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 [1] ","    "."    "</s>" "und"  "der"  ":"    "die"  "\""   ")"    "("   
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
word_embedding_text <- tibble(word = dictionary)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
options(mc.cores = parallel::detectCores())
words_vecs <- get_word_vectors(fasttext_model)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
word_embedding_text <-
  word_embedding_text %>% 
  bind_cols(words_vecs)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
names(word_embedding_text) <- c("word", paste0("v", sprintf("%03d", 1:301)))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: The `value` argument of `names<-` must have the same length as `x` as of tibble
3.0.0.
i `names` must have length 301, not 302.
```
:::
:::


### Recipe Definition rec2

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
rec2 <- 
  recipe(c1 ~ ., data = select(d_train, text, c1, id)) %>% 
  update_role(id, new_role = "id") %>% 
  step_tokenize(text) %>% 
  step_stopwords(text, language = "de", stopword_source = "snowball") %>%
  step_word_embeddings(text, embeddings = word_embedding_text)
 
rec2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Recipe

Inputs:

      role #variables
        id          1
   outcome          1
 predictor          1

Operations:

Tokenization for text
Stop word removal for text
Word embeddings aggregated from text
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
rec2_prep <- rec2 %>% 
  prep() %>% 
  recipes::bake(new_data = NULL)
```
:::


## 5.3 Define Recipe - rec3 - Word Embeddings
### Define Helperfunctions
We are using the package `pradadata` from @sebastian_sauer_2018_1996614. The data are licensed according to General Public License 3 (GLP-3).


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
data("schimpwoerter", package = "pradadata")
data("sentiws", package = "pradadata")
data("wild_emojis", package = "pradadata")
source("C:/Users/sapi-/OneDrive/Studium/5. Semester/Data Science II/Data_Science_Blog/helper/helper_funs.R")
```
:::


## rec3

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
rec3 <-
  recipe(c1 ~., data = select(d_train, text, c1, id)) %>% 
  update_role(id, new_role = "id") %>% 
  step_text_normalization(text) %>% 
  step_mutate(emo_count = map_int(text, ~count_lexicon(.x, sentiws$word))) %>% 
  step_mutate(schimpf_count = map_int(text, ~count_lexicon(.x, schimpfwoerter$word))) %>% 
  step_mutate(wild_emojis = map_int(text, ~count_lexicon(.x, wild_emojis$emoji))) %>% 
  step_mutate(text_copy = text) %>% 
  step_textfeature(text_copy) %>% 
  step_tokenize(text) %>% 
  step_stopwords(text, language = "de", stopword_source = "snowball") %>% 
  step_stem(text) %>% 
  step_word_embeddings(text, embeddings = word_embedding_text)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
rec3_prep <- rec3 %>% 
  prep() %>% 
  recipes::bake(new_data = NULL)
```
:::


## 5.4 Define Recipe - rec4 - TF-IDF
## rec4

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
rec4 <-
  recipe(c1 ~., data = select(d_train, text, c1, id)) %>% 
  update_role(id, new_role = "id") %>% 
  step_text_normalization(text) %>% 
  step_mutate(emo_count = map_int(text, ~count_lexicon(.x, sentiws$word))) %>% 
  step_mutate(schimpf_count = map_int(text, ~count_lexicon(.x, schimpfwoerter$word))) %>% 
  step_mutate(wild_emojis = map_int(text, ~count_lexicon(.x, wild_emojis$emoji))) %>% 
  step_mutate(text_copy = text) %>% 
  step_textfeature(text_copy) %>% 
  step_tokenize(text) %>% 
  step_stopwords(text, language = "de", stopword_source = "snowball") %>% 
  step_stem(text) %>% 
  step_tfidf(text)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
rec4_prep <- rec4 %>% 
  prep() %>% 
  recipes::bake(new_data = NULL)
```
:::


# 6. Build Resamples
Because of the large amount of the data and the extreme extensive recipes, we only use the V-Fold-Cross-Validation. 

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
folds <- vfold_cv(data = d_train,
                  v = 2,
                  repeats = 1,
                  strata = c1)
```
:::


# 7. Build the Penalty-Grid

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lambda_grid <- grid_regular(penalty(), 
                            levels = 30)
```
:::


# 8. Build the Models
## 8.1 Null model

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
null_mod <- null_model() %>% 
  set_engine("parsnip") %>% 
  set_mode("classification")
```
:::


## Define The Workflow

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
wf0 <- workflow() %>% 
  add_recipe(rec1) %>% 
  add_model(null_mod)
```
:::


## Resampling & Model Quality

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
options(mc.cores = parallel::detectCores())
tic()
null_fit <- fit_resamples(
  wf0,
  folds,
  control =control_resamples(save_pred = TRUE)
)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: Paket 'stopwords' wurde unter R Version 4.1.3 erstellt
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
toc()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
79 sec elapsed
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
wf0_performance <- collect_metrics(null_fit)
wf0_performance
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 2 x 6
  .metric  .estimator  mean     n   std_err .config             
  <chr>    <chr>      <dbl> <int>     <dbl> <chr>               
1 accuracy binary     0.663     2 0.0000673 Preprocessor1_Model1
2 roc_auc  binary     0.5       2 0         Preprocessor1_Model1
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
wf_preds <- collect_predictions(null_fit)

wf_preds %>% 
  group_by(id) %>% 
  roc_curve(truth = c1, .pred_OFFENSE) %>% 
  autoplot()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-36-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
conf_mat_resampled(null_fit, tidy = FALSE) %>% 
  autoplot(type = "heatmap")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-37-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


----- *AB HIER WEITER* -----

## 8.2 Lasso-L1 with TF-IDF

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
l1_mod <- logistic_reg(penalty = tune(), mixture = 1) %>% 
  set_engine("glmnet") %>% 
  set_mode("classification")
l1_mod
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Logistic Regression Model Specification (classification)

Main Arguments:
  penalty = tune()
  mixture = 1

Computational engine: glmnet 
```
:::
:::


### Define the Workflow

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
l1_wf <-workflow() %>% 
  add_recipe(rec1) %>% 
  add_model(l1_mod)
l1_wf
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
== Workflow ====================================================================
Preprocessor: Recipe
Model: logistic_reg()

-- Preprocessor ----------------------------------------------------------------
5 Recipe Steps

* step_tokenize()
* step_stopwords()
* step_stem()
* step_tfidf()
* step_normalize()

-- Model -----------------------------------------------------------------------
Logistic Regression Model Specification (classification)

Main Arguments:
  penalty = tune()
  mixture = 1

Computational engine: glmnet 
```
:::
:::


### Resampling & Model Quality 

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
options(mc.cores = parallel::detectCores())
l1_wf_fit_v <- tune_grid(
  l1_wf,
  folds,
  grid = lambda_grid,
  control = control_resamples(save_pred = TRUE)
)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: Paket 'glmnet' wurde unter R Version 4.1.3 erstellt
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: Paket 'Matrix' wurde unter R Version 4.1.3 erstellt
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
l1_wf_performance <- collect_metrics(l1_wf_fit_v)
l1_wf_performance
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 60 x 7
    penalty .metric  .estimator  mean     n std_err .config              
      <dbl> <chr>    <chr>      <dbl> <int>   <dbl> <chr>

10 2.40e- 9 roc_auc  binary     0.736     2 0.00384 Preprocessor1_Model05
# ... with 50 more rows
```
:::
:::


#### Metrics

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
collect_metrics(l1_wf_fit_v)
```


```{.r .cell-code}
chosen_auc_l1_wf_fit_v <- 
  l1_wf_fit_v %>%

chosen_auc_l1_wf_fit_v
```

## 8.3 Ridge-Regression-L2 with TF-IDF

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
l2_mod <- logistic_reg(penalty = tune(), mixture = 0) %>% 
  set_engine("glmnet") %>% 
  set_mode("classification")
l2_mod
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Logistic Regression Model Specification (classification)

Main Arguments:
  penalty = tune()
  mixture = 0

Computational engine: glmnet 
```
:::
:::


### Define the Workflow

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
l2_wf <-workflow() %>% 
  add_recipe(rec1) %>% 
  add_model(l2_mod)
l2_wf
```

```

Logistic Regression Model Specification (classification)

  penalty = tune()

```

```{.r .cell-code}
options(mc.cores = parallel::detectCores())
l2_wf_fit_v <- tune_grid(

  folds,

)
```

## 8.4 Ridge-Regression-L2 with Word Embeddings

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lasso_mod1 <- logistic_reg(penalty = tune(), mixture = 0) %>% 
  set_engine("glmnet") %>% 
  set_mode("classification")
lasso_mod1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Logistic Regression Model Specification (classification)

Main Arguments:
  penalty = tune()
  mixture = 0

Computational engine: glmnet 
```
:::
:::


### Define the Workflow

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
we_l1_wf <- workflow() %>% 
  add_recipe(rec2) %>% 
  add_model(lasso_mod1)
we_l1_wf
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
== Workflow ====================================================================
Preprocessor: Recipe
Model: logistic_reg()

-- Preprocessor ----------------------------------------------------------------
3 Recipe Steps

* step_tokenize()
* step_stopwords()
* step_word_embeddings()

-- Model -----------------------------------------------------------------------
Logistic Regression Model Specification (classification)

Main Arguments:
  penalty = tune()
  mixture = 0

Computational engine: glmnet 
```
:::
:::


### Resampling & Model Quality 

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
options(mc.cores = parallel::detectCores())
we_l1_fit <- tune_grid(
  we_l1_wf,
  folds,
  grid = lambda_grid,
  control = control_resamples(save_pred = TRUE)
)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
collect_metrics(we_l1_fit)
```

## 8.5 Lasso-L1 with Word Embeddings and rec3

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lasso_mod1_3 <- logistic_reg(penalty = tune(), mixture = 1) %>% 
  set_engine("glmnet") %>% 
  set_mode("classification")
lasso_mod1_3
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Logistic Regression Model Specification (classification)

Main Arguments:
  penalty = tune()
  mixture = 1

Computational engine: glmnet 
```
:::
:::


### Define the Workflow

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
we_l1_wf3 <- workflow() %>% 
  add_recipe(rec3) %>% 
  add_model(lasso_mod1_3)
we_l1_wf3
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
== Workflow ====================================================================
Preprocessor: Recipe
Model: logistic_reg()

-- Preprocessor ----------------------------------------------------------------
10 Recipe Steps

* step_text_normalization()
* step_mutate()
* step_mutate()
* step_mutate()
* step_mutate()
* step_textfeature()
* step_tokenize()
* step_stopwords()
* step_stem()
* step_word_embeddings()

-- Model -----------------------------------------------------------------------
Logistic Regression Model Specification (classification)

Main Arguments:
  penalty = tune()
  mixture = 1

Computational engine: glmnet 
```
:::
:::


### Resampling & Model Quality 

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
options(mc.cores = parallel::detectCores())
we_l1_fit3 <- tune_grid(
  we_l1_wf3,
  folds,
  grid = lambda_grid,
  control = control_resamples(save_pred = TRUE)
)
```
